title: How to Make Eggnog Fudge

steps.headline: Spread butter over a 8 or 9 inch (20.3 or 22.9 cm) square baking pan.
Boil the butter, sugar, and eggnog in a large saucepan.
Lower the heat to medium and heat and continue to heat until the mixture is 234° Fahrenheit (112° Celsius).
steps.description: Stir occasionally with a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Remove the eggnog mixture from the heat and shut the stove off.
Add in the nutmeg and white chocolate.
steps.description: Stir with a rubber spatula until the chocolate fully melts.

steps.headline: Pour in the marshmallow creme and vanilla.
Beat the eggnog mixture with whisk in a large bowl.
steps.description: Whisk until the mixture is creamy and blended properly.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture onto the baking pan.
Allow the fudge to chill until it fully sets, taking about 30 minutes.
Slice the fudge into squares using a knife.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the fudge on a serving plate and enjoy with a cup of eggnog. Enjoy!

text: Spread butter over a 8 or 9 inch (20.3 or 22.9 cm) square baking pan.  Boil the butter, sugar, and eggnog in a large saucepan.  Lower the heat to medium and heat and continue to heat until the mixture is 234° Fahrenheit (112° Celsius). Stir occasionally with a wooden spoon. Remove the eggnog mixture from the heat and shut the stove off.  Add in the nutmeg and white chocolate. Stir with a rubber spatula until the chocolate fully melts. Pour in the marshmallow creme and vanilla.  Beat the eggnog mixture with whisk in a large bowl. Whisk until the mixture is creamy and blended properly. Pour the mixture onto the baking pan.  Allow the fudge to chill until it fully sets, taking about 30 minutes.  Slice the fudge into squares using a knife.  Serve. Place the fudge on a serving plate and enjoy with a cup of eggnog. Enjoy!
